message_1: Evaluate the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2-7x+12)/(x-3) as x approaches 3.
message_2:
To evaluate the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 7x + 12) / (x - 3) as x approaches 3, we can first try to simplify the function by factoring the numerator.

The numerator can be factored as follows:

x^2 - 7x + 12 = (x - 3)(x - 4)

Now, the function can be written as:

f(x) = ((x - 3)(x - 4)) / (x - 3)

We can cancel out the (x - 3) terms:

f(x) = x - 4

Now, we can find the limit as x approaches 3:

lim (x -> 3) (x - 4) = 3 - 4 = -1

So, the limit of the function f(x) as x approaches 3 is -1.
